intro: Eucalyptus phenax subsp. compressa, commonly known as the Narrow-leaf Box Gum, is a small to medium-sized eucalyptus species native to southern Australia. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often grey-green in color. The flowers are typically small and white or cream, arranged in clusters at the ends of branches. This subspecies is typically found in dry sclerophyll forests and woodlands, often growing in sandy or loamy soils. It plays an important ecological role in providing habitat and food for native wildlife.
